intro: Tylophora angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf tylophora, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves and clusters of small, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in moist, shaded environments. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, and it produces small, fleshy fruits that contain seeds. Tylophora angustifolia is sometimes used in traditional medicine for its purported therapeutic properties.
